sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"皮，皮肤"之意。
means: skin ： 最常用词，指人的皮肤或动物的皮，也可指水果、植物和种子等的外皮。
leather ： 通常指经过加工的熟皮，可用于制作各种皮革制品。
fur ： 现多指猫、兔等动物软毛皮，也指其它动物的毛皮。
hide ： 多指大型动物的厚皮，也指没有鞣的牛、马等皮革。
peel ： 指剩下的或可以剥去的果皮或蔬菜皮。

word_mean: 皮肤：身体外层的被复物，由表皮、真皮构成，附于皮下组织
蒙于机体或翼面骨架外面构成所需气动外形的板件。

sentence.Network_en: If your skin becomes red, sore or very scaly, consult your doctor.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果皮肤发红、瘙痒或脱皮，要向医生咨询。

sentence.Network_en: Daily facial exercises help her to retain the skin's elasticity.
sentence.Network_cn: 每天做面部运动帮助她保持皮肤弹性。

sentence.Network_en: He won, but only by the skin of his teeth.
sentence.Network_cn: 他赢了，但是赢得十分勉强。

it was the sheer effrontery of them which got under my skin.

reach or display a deep understanding of someone

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to indicate that one is not offended or adversely affected by something
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)无损某人的毫毛，对某人毫无影响

phrase.cizu_name: keep (或 sleep in) a whole skin

phrase.cizu_name: there's more than one way to skin a cat

jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)达到目的的方法不止一种
激怒某人：惹怒或刺激；激起
在本质上，在内心上：在表面以下；基本地

lj.lj_ly: enemies who are really brothers under the skin.
lj.lj_ls: 敌人实际上是真正的兄弟

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English scinn, from Old Norse skinn; related to Dutch schinden 'flay, peel' and German schinden

entry.def: Your skin is the natural covering of your body.

example.ex: His skin is clear and smooth...
There are three major types of skin cancer...

entry.def: An animal skin is skin which has been removed from a dead animal. Skins are used to make things such as coats and rugs.
The skin of a fruit or vegetable is its outer layer or covering.

example.ex: The outer skin of the orange is called the 'zest'.

entry.def: If a skin forms on the surface of a liquid, a thin, fairly solid layer forms on it.

example.ex: Stir the custard occasionally to prevent a skin forming.
example.tran: 要不时地搅拌牛奶蛋糊，防止其表面结皮。

entry.tran: 剥去(死动物)的皮;将…去皮
entry.def: If you skin a dead animal, you remove its skin.

example.ex: ...with the expertise of a chef skinning a rabbit.
example.tran: 具有大厨剥兔子皮的娴熟技艺

entry.tran: 吓得魂飞魄散;大吃一惊
entry.def: If something makes you jump out of your skin, it surprises or shocks you very much.

example.ex: He nearly jumped out of his skin when he saw two rats.
example.tran: 他看到两只老鼠，几乎给吓丢了魂。

entry.tran: 保命;保全自己;设法摆脱困境
entry.def: If you try to save your own skin or save your skin, you try to save yourself from something dangerous or unpleasant.

example.ex: He'd have done anything to anybody to save his own skin.
example.tran: 为了活命，他可以不顾任何人，不择手段。

entry.tran: 侥幸;好不容易才;险些儿没有
entry.def: If you do something by the skin of your teeth, you just manage to do it.

example.ex: He won, but only by the skin of his teeth.
example.tran: 他赢了，但是赢得十分勉强。

entry.def: If you say that someone has a thick skin, you mean that they are able to listen to criticism about themselves without becoming offended.

example.ex: You need a thick skin to be a headmaster.
example.tran: 要当校长，你就得脸皮厚一些。

means.word_mean: 1. a natural protective covering of the body; site of the sense of touch;

sentences.sentence: "your skin is the largest organ of your body"

means.word_mean: 2. the tissue forming the hard outer layer (of e.g. a fruit)
4. body covering of a living animal
5. a person's skin regarded as their life;
6. the rind of a fruit or vegetable
7. a bag serving as a container for liquids; it is made from the skin of an animal
1. climb awkwardly, as if by scrambling
2. bruise, cut, or injure the skin or the surface of;

sentences.sentence: "The boy skinned his knee when he fell"

means.word_mean: 3. remove the bark of a tree

sentences.sentence: "She stubbed her one's toe in the dark and now it's broken"

example.en: Whether you make it or not,it's no skin off my ass.
example.zh: 不管你做不做得成，跟我都没关系。

auth_sentence.res_content_con: You certainly need to have thick skin for it!

abbreviation.mean_cn: 阿凯尼的荣耀(分为08/09两种)

Sentence.sentence: Behind the differences in sex, skin tones and mother tongues, there are common attitudes, expectations and ambitions which risk creating a set of clones among the business leaders of the future.
You know I've often wondered why people laugh at the picture of a big belly businessman slipping on a banana skin and falling on his bottom.

While the team can't be sure their results are due solely to Obama, they also showed that those with the lowest bias were likely to subconsciously associate black skin colour with political words such as "government" or "president".

sentences.en: The nurse pierced the skin of the boy with a lancet.
sentences.cn: 护士用刺血针刺入男孩的皮肤。

sentences.en: Cats are covered with soft skin.

means.word_mean: (蔬菜, 水果等)外皮, 外壳

sentences.en: I slipped on a banana skin.
sentences.cn: 我踩在香蕉皮上滑倒了。
那个男孩剥去了香蕉皮。

sentences.en: Are you trying to skin the old lady?

jushi.english: Take the skin off before you eat it.
I slipped on a banana skin.
jushi.chinese: 我踩在香蕉皮上滑倒了。

jushi.english: Most Africans have darker skins than Europeans.
jushi.chinese: 多数非洲人的皮肤比欧洲人黑些。
